page.title: 07Fine Fare Development
page.content: Workmen in Louth in '85 have been kept busy building a new FineFare supermarket which is to be opened during Autumn of '85. It will affect the town in many ways.We put questions to shopkeepers in the town centre to discover their views.Most said it would help their businesses by keeping shoppers in town, others thought the building wouldn't affect them. All agreed that the size of the building and parking facilities would attract people to it. The manager of the present Fine Fare explained that security officers would probably be used to combat shoplifting. The new shop would help Louth by creating over 100 new jobs.The new site is away from the main shopping area to allow it to be quite enormous and provide 200 parking spaces. Steel girders and traditional red bricks are being used.
